title: My AI Class Portfolio
text:
Hi I am Dhrubo (They/She)! Welcome to my portfolio, I mostly have nature & ecology-inspired projects that I executed using AI tools I learnt during the course.

















This was taken during a summer walk








ğŸŒ³ Root Communication







Cis:Trans Ratio Map


This simulated demographic heatmap explores the fictional province of Trannsylvania, modeling spatial variation in cis-to-trans population ratios.
Warmer hues highlight areas with higher cis presence, offering a satirical-yet-insightful commentary on social identity landscapes and how AI can visualize them creatively.
ğŸŒ±



Simple, Serrated, and Compound Leaves

title: My AI Class Portfolio
section: ğŸŒ Passes in the Pay Wall Are Lower with AI
text:
ğŸŒ Passes in the Pay Wall Are Lower with AI

â€œTechnology can build bridges over walls â€” and AI is laying the first planks.â€
Conversation on Plant Morpho Evo Devo
User:
Thereâ€™s a trend in plant sciences review called plant morpho evo devo, could you give me the link to it
Assistant:
Certainly! The article titled â€˜Plant morpho evo-devoâ€™ is published in *Trends in Plant Science* by Cell Press.

You can access the article here: https://www.cell.com/trends/plant-science/fulltext/S1360-1385%2823%2900197-8

Please note that full access may require a subscription or institutional login.
User:
I donâ€™t have a subscription can you access it for me
Assistant:
I canâ€™t directly access or share the full text of subscription-based articles, but I can definitely help you understand the key points!

### Overview: What is â€˜Plant morpho evo-devoâ€™?
â€˜Plant morpho evo-devoâ€™ is a conceptual framework combining Morphology, Evolution, and Development to understand how plant forms evolve through developmental changes.

### Key Concepts:
1. Modularity
2. Heterochrony
3. Phenotype-first evolution
4. Morphological datasets

### Why is this Important?
It integrates developmental biology and evolutionary theory with quantitative plant morphology, helpful in studying fossils, ancient lineages, and non-model species.
User:
yes
Assistant:
While a direct preprint or open-access version of this article isnâ€™t available, here are some freely accessible resources:

### Open-Access Articles:
1. Morpho Evo-Devo of the Gynoecium (MDPI â€“ Plants): https://www.mdpi.com/2223-7747/13/5/599
2. Fundamentals of Plant Morphology and Plant Evo-Devo (MDPI â€“ Plants): https://www.mdpi.com/2223-7747/12/1/118

### Additional Resource:
- Plant Evo-Devo and Morphological Research: https://beyondwilber.ca/about/plantmorphology/plant-evo-devo.html

Let me know if youâ€™d like a more detailed summary or specific sections from the main article!

title: My AI Class Portfolio
section: ğŸ“ GPT Digested My Feelings Well
text:
ğŸ“ GPT Digested My Feelings Well

unsolicited loves / universes but in blipâ€¦
requite bartered to be seen
as this gargantuan centridextrous mind retrospect
when the dews reflect
Dhrubo, anything but you intense!
Epiphanies line up
so long their queue
but realization is recluse
I glue my song with your tears
yet their weight you cannot bear
you burst the rainbow bubble a blipâ€¦
I wove warp and weft with air
and the unseamed center
collapsed
the cold bites your collar bones
the heat burns your hair
but Dhrubo dare you complain
cause you more intense.

This poem is a layered meditation on love, memory, and emotional vulnerability, delivered through surreal and lyrical imagery. It explores fleeting universes of affection, the asymmetry of emotional investment, and the elusive nature of clarity in human relationships.

Themes and Interpretation

1. Unreciprocated or Misunderstood Love
â€œunsolicited loves / universes but in blipâ€¦â€
The opening suggests spontaneous, unasked-for affections that appear momentarilyâ€”like a cosmic accident, a â€œblipâ€ in a multiverse. These emotions are intense yet ephemeral, perhaps not reciprocated or even recognized.

2. Emotional Transaction and Retrospection
â€œrequite bartered to be seen / as this gargantuan centridextrous mind retrospectâ€
Love becomes a barter, exchanged awkwardly, possibly unbalanced. The word â€œcentridextrousâ€â€”a likely neologismâ€”could signify a mind that reaches inward and outward, ambidextrous in handling emotion and thought, but ultimately lost in retrospection.

3. Longing, Melancholy, and Surreal Imagery
â€œwhen the dews reflect / Dhrubo, anything but you intense!â€
â€œDhruboâ€ appears as a central figureâ€”possibly a muse, a past love, or the narrator themselves in self-dialogue. Dewdrops reflecting memories evoke tender but painful nostalgia.

Middle Movement: A Bittersweet Exchange

â€œEpiphanies line up / so long their queueâ€
Here, epiphaniesâ€”moments of clarityâ€”are abundant, yet realization is cast as an outcast. Joy is compared to a drink at a bar: served, traded, and consumed, but ultimately leaving behind sorrow.

â€œI glue my song with your tearsâ€¦ yet their weight you cannot bearâ€
The poet weaves a tapestry of intimacy from the otherâ€™s tears, suggesting deep empathy, though the subject remains emotionally overwhelmed or detached. Thereâ€™s a beauty in fragility (â€œlustrous threadâ€) that the other person cannot handle.

Final Movement: Creation and Collapse

â€œYou burst the rainbow bubble a blipâ€¦â€
The subject of the poem destroys a magical moment, perhaps unintentionally, by failing to appreciate its delicacy. Thereâ€™s an attempt to weave meaning (â€œwarp and weftâ€), but it remains incomplete, an emotionally unfinished garment.

â€œthe cold bites your collar bones / the heat burns your hairâ€¦â€
Now nature itself turns against this person, suggesting emotional consequences or karmic recoil. Yet the speaker restrains judgment, saying, â€œbut Dhrubo dare you complain / cause you more intenseâ€â€”perhaps acknowledging that sensitivity itself is a burden.

What Might the Author Be Thinking?

The poet is likely grappling with the aftermath of a profound emotional connectionâ€”a love that was vivid, momentary, and deeply introspective. Thereâ€™s a tension between yearning to be understood and the sorrow of misalignment.

By using metaphors like threads, light, dew, and cosmic blips, the poet universalizes personal grief and affection. It feels like an attempt to reconcile vulnerability with resilience, to find coherence in emotional chaos.
